meanings.definition: To blow or breathe into or upon.
meanings.sent1: She insufflates air into the balloon to make it bigger.
meanings.sent2: The wind insufflates the scent of flowers through the open window.
meanings.sent3: He insufflates bubbles into his drink with a straw, making it fizz.
meanings.sent4: The magician insufflates magic into his wand, making it glow brightly.
meanings.sent5: The child insufflates life into the paper sailboat, sending it sailing across the pond.

meanings.definition: To blow (something) into a body cavity.
meanings.sent1: The doctor insufflates air into the patient's lungs during the procedure.
meanings.sent2: The researcher insufflates dye into the bloodstream to highlight the veins.
meanings.sent3: The chef insufflates flavor into the dish by adding a pinch of herbs.
meanings.sent4: The storm insufflates sand into every nook and cranny, covering everything in a fine layer.
meanings.sent5: The teacher insufflates knowledge into the young minds, helping them grow and learn.

meanings.definition: To introduce (a drug) into the body by breathing or inhaling.
meanings.sent1: The patient insufflates the medication to relieve congestion in the sinuses.
meanings.sent2: Athletes sometimes insufflate performance-enhancing drugs to gain an edge.
meanings.sent3: The cat insufflates catnip, feeling its effects almost instantly.
meanings.sent4: The music insufflates energy into the crowd, making them dance and sing along.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies insufflates warmth and comfort into the room.
